imzML_Writer.gui_functions module

imzML_Writer.gui_functions.RAW_to_mzML(path, sl, write_mode)[source]

Calls msConvert via docker on linux and Mac, or calls _viaPwiz method on PC to manage conversion of raw vendor files to mzML format within the specified path

imzML_Writer.gui_functions.annotate_imzML(annotate_file, SRC_mzML, scan_time=0.001, filter_string='none given', x_speed=1, y_step=1)[source]

Takes pyimzml output imzML files and annotates them using GUI inputs and the corresponding mzML source file. annotate_file = the imzML file to be annotated SRC_mzML = the source file to pull metadata from scan_time = how long it took to scan across the tissue (default = 0.001) filter_string = what scan filter is actually captured (default = “none given”)

imzML_Writer.gui_functions.clean_raw_files(path, sl, file_type)[source]

Cleans up file system after RAW_to_mzML has completed, creating two folders within the specified path: Initial RAW files - raw vendor files Output mzML Files - processed mzML files output by msConvert Inputs: path - path to directory to clean up sl - legacy code, should just be ‘/’ file_type - extension for raw files to know what to sort

imzML_Writer.gui_functions.find_file(target, folder)[source]
imzML_Writer.gui_functions.find_msconvert()[source]
imzML_Writer.gui_functions.get_drives()[source]
imzML_Writer.gui_functions.get_file_type(path)[source]

Identifies the file type in the specified path, ignoring hidden files starting with . Returns the file extension

imzML_Writer.gui_functions.imzML_metadata_process(model_files, sl, x_speed, y_step, tgt_progress, path)[source]

Manages annotation of imzML files with metadata from source mzML files and user-specified fields (GUI). Inputs: model_files - Directory to the folder containing mzML files sl - legacy, use ‘/’ x_speed - scan speed in the x-direction, µm/sec y_step - step between strip lines, µm tgt_progress - Tkinter progress bar object to update as the process continues path - path to the directory where imzML files should be stored after annotation

imzML_Writer.gui_functions.move_files(probe_txt, path)[source]

Moves the annotated imzML files into the same directory as the source raw files of the image under a new folder matching the datafile names

imzML_Writer.gui_functions.mzML_to_imzML_convert(progress_target, PATH='/Users/josephmonaghan/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-VancouverIslandUniversity/imzML_TechnicalNote/imzML_Writer', LOCK_MASS=0, TOLERANCE=20)[source]

Handles conversion of mzML files to the imzML format using the pyimzml library. Converts data line-by-line (one mzML at a time), aligning data based on scan time and splitting into separate imzML files for each scan in the source mzML. Inputs: progress_target - tkinter progress bar object from the GUI to update as conversion progresses path - Working path for source mzML files Lock mass - m/z to use for coarse m/z recalibration if desired. 0 = No recalibration Tolerance - search tolerance (in ppm) with which to correct m/z based on the specified lock mass. Default 20 ppm

imzML_Writer.recalibrate_mz module

imzML_Writer.recalibrate_mz.recalibrate(mz, int, lock_mz, search_tol, ppm_off)[source]

Performs a coarse m/z recalibration based on shifting a lock mass back to target, and everything else by the same ppm shift
